Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD made its findings in a perverse or capricious manner or without regard to the evidence
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, S.C. 2001, c. 27
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the IRPA
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's credibility undermined by lack of documentation, inconsistent clan knowledge, and weak witness testimony
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to provide sufficient evidence to support identity and persecution claims
Crimes.Application_Error: Minor errors regarding identity documentation that did not affect overall determination
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness on judicial review
Crimes.Application_Factor: Opportunities to obtain US records but failed to do so
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Perversity or capriciousness in RPD’s findings
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Sections 96, 97, 106 – definition of Convention refugee, person in need of protection, and credibility assessment
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence to establish identity and credible fear of persecution
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of official documents, inconsistent personal knowledge, weak corroboration
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation through lack of valid Somali or US documentation
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent testimony and failure to substantiate background
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of persecution based on clan and political opinion
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of efforts to obtain supporting documents
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to obtain available US records
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and lack of credible identity

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of refugee claim involving document fraud
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD made findings in a perverse or capricious manner despite use of fraudulent documents
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, S.C. 2001, c. 27
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Applicant lacked credible identity documents and had limited supporting evidence
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish identity and need for protection
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Use of fraudulent travel documents and minimal interaction with witnesses
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Sections 96, 97, and 106 of IRPA govern refugee definition and credibility assessment
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural fairness in assessing credibility
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution based on clan and political opinion
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to lack of credible evidence
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for refugee claims
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Certification of a question of law
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Use of fraudulent travel documents and misrepresentation
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Refugee protection determination and judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Sections 96, 97, 106 – Refugee status and credibility requirements
